gurmukhi: Awpn hIAY AYs Anumwnw ]qIsr gurU Xwh hm mwnw ]pRym sUq kI for bFwvY ]qbhI nwQ inrMjn pwvY ]177]
transliteration: Apan Hiai Ais Anoumana|| Teesar Guroo Yaah Ham Maanaa|| Prem Soot Ki Dor Badhaavai|| Tab-hinaath Niranjan Paavai||177||
translation: Contemplating in his mind, he said this, “I consider it my third Guru; when the thread of love will extend, then only the Lord (Nath Niranjan-the unmanifested Brahman) will be realized.”177.

gurmukhi: Awpn Awpu Awp mo drsY ]AMqir gurU Awqmw prsY ]iek Cwif kY Anq n DwvY ]qb hI prm qqu ko pwvY ]178]
transliteration: Aapan Aap(u) Aap Mo Darsai|| Antar(i) Guroo Aatmaa Parsai|| Ik Chhaad(i) Kai Anat Na Dhaavai|| Tab Hiparam Tat(u) Ko Paavai||178||
translation: When the self will be visualized and within oneself the soul-Guru will be touched and the mind will not go anywhere else, leaving the ONE, then only the Supreme Essence will be realized.178.

gurmukhi: eyk srUp eyk kir dyKY ]Awn Bwv ko Bwv n pyKY ]eyk Aws qij Anq n DwvY ]qb hI nwQ inrMjn pwvY ]179]
transliteration: Ek Saroop Ek Kar(i) Dekhai|| Aan Bhaav Ko Bhaav Na Pekhai|| Ek Aas Taj(i) Anat Na Dhaavai|| Tab Hinaath Niranjan Paavai||179||
translation: When the form of one will be considered and seen as One and no other thought will come into the mind and keeping one objective before oneself, the mind will not run anywhere else, then the Lord (Nath Niranjan---the unmanifested Brahman).179.

gurmukhi: kyvl AMg rMg iqh rwcY ]eyk Cwif rsnyk n mwcY ]prm q`q ko iDAwn lgwvY ]qb hI nwQ inrMjn pwvY ]180]
transliteration: Keval An Ran Tih Raachai|| Ek Chhaad(i) Rasnek Na Maachai|| Param Tatt Ko Dhiaan Lagadvai|| Tab Hinaath Niranjan Paavai||180||
translation: When the merger will be in only one and the mind will not be obsurbed in anyone else accept the ONE and meditate only on the supreme esselce, then it will realise the lord ( Nath Niranjan-the Unmanifasted brahman) 180

gurmukhi: qIsr gurU mkirkw TwnI ]Awgy clw d`q AiBmwnI ]qw kr Bwv hiRdy mih lInw ]hrKvMq qb clw pRbInw ]181]
transliteration: Teesar Guroo Makarikaa Thaanee|| Aage Chalaa Datt Abhimaanee|| Taa Kar Bhaav Hride Maih Leenaa|| Harkhvant Tab Chalaa Prabeenaa||181||
translation: Accepting the spider as the third Guru, the glorious Dutt moved further; getting greatly pleased, he moved forward, adopting their connotation in his heart.181.
End of the adoption of Spider as the third Guru.
Now begins the description of the fourth Guru Crane.

gurmukhi: jbY d`q guru AwgY isDwrw ]m`C rws kr bYiT inhwrw ]au`jl AMg Aiq iDAwn lgwvY ]monI srb iblok ljwvY ]182]
transliteration: Jabai Datt Gur(u) Aagad Sidhaaraa, Machchh Raas Kar Baith(i) Nihaaraa|| Ujjal An At(i) Dhiaan Lagadvai|| Monidarab Bilok Lajaavai||182||
translation: When Dutt moved forward, then after seeing the swarm of fish, he saw towards the meditating crane; his limbs were extremely white and seeing him all the silence-observing creatures felt shy.182.

gurmukhi: jYsk iDAwn m`C kY kwjw ]lwvq bk nwvY inrlwjw ]BlI BwNq ieh iDAwn lgwvY ]Bwv qws ko muin mn BwvY ]183]
transliteration: Jaisak Dhiaan Machchh Kai Kaajaa|| Laavat Bak Naavai Nitlaajaa|| Bhalibhaant Eh Dhiaan Lagadvai|| Bhaav Taas Ko Mounndi) Man Bhaavai||183||
translation: The meditation that was being observed by the crane, made his name shameful because of his meditativeness for fish; he was observing meditation very nicely and with his silence, he was pleasing the sages.183.

gurmukhi: AYso iDAwn nwQ ihq l`eIAY ]qbhI prm purK khu p`eIAY ]m`CwNqk liK d`q luBwnw ]cqRQ gurU qws Anmwnw ]184]
transliteration: Aiso Dhiaan Naathhit Laeeeeai|| Tab-hiparam Purakh Kaoub Paooai|| Machchhaadtak Lakh(i) Datt Loubhaanaa|| Chatrath Guroo Taas Anmaanaa||184||
translation: If such a medittativeness is observed for the sake of that Lord, He is realized in that way; seeing the crane, Dutt was allured towards him and he accepted him as his fourth Guru.184.
End of the description of the adoption of Crane as the fourth Guru.
